_source.message:
Head of French Intelligence resigns over Ukraine

Details: the head of the French Intelligence, General Eric Vidot, is resigning. "General Vidot is being dismissed due to the fact that he and his subordinates failed to provide the country's leadership with sufficiently accurate information about Russia's intentions," reported by the publication l'Opinion, citing sources in military circles.

The AFP agency, in turn, clarifies that Vidot is resigning just seven months after being appointed head of intelligence, not only because he did not foresee a Russian attack on Ukraine, but also because he could not reorganize his department.

WORLD TOGETHER WITH UKRAINE 
All news: link

If you haven't been following this, an unusual number of soldiers have been dying at Ft Hood and Ft Bragg in the last two years, including some shot several times and others found with their heads chopped off.

_source.message:
⚡️⚡️🇫🇷 The head of the General Directorate of Military Intelligence of France (DRM), General Eric Vido, was dismissed due to "professional inconsistency" and "poor knowledge of the subject."
In an interview with Le Monde, Chief of the Defense Staff Thierry Burkhard publicly acknowledged that the French intelligence services (including the DRM) made the wrong analysis of the Russian threat in Ukraine, unlike the Americans and the British.

⚡️⚡️🇫🇷 Руководитель Главного управления военной разведки Франции (DRM) генерал Эрик Видо отправлен в отставку — из-за "профессионального несоответствия" и "слабого владения предметом".
В интервью Le Monde начальник штаба обороны Тьерри Буркхард публично признал, что французские спецслужбы (включая DRM) сделали ошибочный анализ российской угрозы в Украине, в отличие от американцев и англичан.

The UN has named the composition of the commission that will investigate war crimes in Ukraine.  Recall that it was created on March 4th.

 Collect and analyze materials on what is happening in Ukraine will be:

 ▪️Former Judge of the European Court of Human Rights Eric Mese from Norway,
 ▪️Ombudsman for Human Rights in Bosnia and Herzegovina Jasminka Dzumhur,
 ▪️UN Special Rapporteur Pablo de Greiffa (Colombia).

 The commission has been set up for a year.  Its members must "investigate all alleged violations, and violations of human rights, and violations of international humanitarian law, and related crimes in the context of aggression against Ukraine by the Russian Federation."

 A comprehensive written report will be presented at the 52nd session of the UN in March 2023.

_source.channelabout: Legendary public Украина сейчас now in English. No fakes. Please, share. People should know.

_source.message:
UN appoints commission to investigate possible war crimes in Ukraine

The commission was headed by the former head of the International Tribunal for Rwanda, Norwegian Eric Mese, writes Reuters. The Commission also included the Commissioner for Human Rights in Bosnia and Herzegovina, Jasminka Dzumhur, and the UN Special Rapporteur, Colombian Pablo de Greiff.

The Human Rights Council set up a commission to investigate the situation in Ukraine in early March. This was requested by the authorities of Ukraine, as well as the EU, the US and the UK. The first results of the investigation are expected to be announced in September.🤔👇

Kremlin: UN Commission to Investigate Possible War Crimes in Ukraine to have 'careful work', Moscow has collected a lot of evidence about what is happening. 👍

Wealthy family of 5 each commit suicide by jumping off apartment building

>A wealthy French family obsessed with conspiracy theories linked to Covid jumped to their deaths from their seventh-floor apartment in Montreux, Switzerland, according to police.
>The bodies of Eric David, 40, Nasrine Feraoun, 41, her twin sister Narjisse, and their 8-year-old daughter were found at the bottom of a seven-story building just 45 minutes after police arrived at their door. 
>However, the 15-year-old son survived the fall, he remains in stable condition in the hospital.
>Technical investigations show no warning signs of such an act,' noting however that 'since the start of the pandemic, the family was very interested in conspiracy and survivalist theories'
>Living in virtual self-sufficiency, the family had [...]

_source.channelabout: Welcome to the Official Wisconsin Audit Watch Chat, sister chat to @AZAuditChat. Buckle up, because Arizona Audit Watch has your back and WWG1WGA!
_source.message:
Hacking America's Computerized Voting System

Featuring: Prof. J. Alex Halderman, Kim Zetter, Prof. Dan Wallach, Douglas Lute, Prof. Philip Stark, Prof. Matt Blaze, Prof. Andrew Appel, Jake Braun, James Clapper, Harri Hursti, Eric Coomer, Hillary Clinton, Sen. Amy Klobuchar, Sen. Ron Wyden, Rep. Adam Schiff, Rep. Sheila Jackson Lee, Rep. Val Demings, Rep. Jennifer Wexton, Rep. Ted Lieu, Sen. Kamala Harris, Rep. Zoe Lofgren, and Gov. Terry McAuliffe

Voters should demand hand-marked paper ballots at the polling place and mandatory rigorous post-election audits.

Voters should also demand, for a start, to ban remote access software, wireless modems, direct-recording electronic, and ballot-marking device voting systems.

Americans deserve to know every single line of code and every single piece of hardware that counts their votes.

America’s elections must shift from a proprietary, privately-owned system to one that is open-source, available for public inspection, and completely owned by the American people.

Rumble | Substack | @KanekoaTheGreat

_source.channelabout: Articles: https://thuletide.wordpress.com/ - Twitter: https://twitter.com/thuletide
_source.message:
It would not surprise me one iota if some dissidents in the West are being paid to shill Kremlin / GRU propaganda or are, at the very least, fishing for Kremlinbux.

See, for example, Charles Bausman who owns the pro-Kremlin propaganda website, 'Russia Insider.' He is reportedly financed by Russian oligarch Konstantin Malofeev via Alexey Komov (source).

Malofeev also funds Russian separatists in Ukraine, and founded/funded Aleksandr Dugin's thinktank 'Katehon' (which is aimed at subverting Westerners) and Tsargrad TV, on which Dugin has a show (source).

Apparently, TRS' National Justice Party throws events at a barn on Bausman's $450k 5-acre property, which is also home to one of NJP's founders, Greg Conte. (source). 

And, apparently, Eric Striker's National-Justice website shares a Google analytics account with Russia Insider and also uses the same web code (source).

So, maybe this explains all of the weird Alt-Right and Identitarian links to Aleksandr Dugin that I've been talking about for years?  🤔

In today's episode:


Joe Rogan flirts with the idea of leaving his Spotify deal if he's not able to do his show the way he wants

GOP members of the House Judiciary Committee send letters to Facebook and Twitter seeking documents and other evidence related to their suppression of the Hunter Biden laptop story

Google's former CEO Eric Schmidt has been funding, through his "philanthropic" organization, the Office of Science and Technology Policy and to cover up this blatant influence-trading, Vox theorizes the solution is to spend more taxpayer money

A friend and business partner of Nancy Pelosi's son has been convicted of running a scam in partnership with the younger Pelosi and the United Nations

Vladimir Putin sets the terms for Russian oil and gas and says in no uncertain terms that he will stop supplying Europe if they do not agree to transact in rubles

Project Syndicate responds to Putin having globalism over a barrel by deciding the solution is more environmental communism and that things will be better than ever before

Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov announces the end of the era of a unipolar global order.

_source.message:
Chris Hedges: On Being Disappeared

The entire archive of On Contact, the Emmy-nominated show I hosted for six years for RT America and RT International, has been disappeared from YouTube. 

Gone is the interview with Nathaniel Philbrick on his book about George Washington.

Gone is the discussion with Kai Bird on his biography of J. Robert Oppenheimer.

Gone is my exploration with Professor Sam Slote from Trinity College Dublin of James Joyce’s “Ulysses.” 

Gone is the show with Benjamin Moser on his biography of Susan Sontag. 

Gone is the show with Stephen Kinzer on his book on John Foster Dulles and Allen Dulles. 

Gone are the interviews with the social critics Cornel West, Tariq Ali, Noam Chomsky, Gerald Horne, Wendy Brown, Paul Street, Gabriel Rockwell, Naomi Wolff and Slavoj Zizek. 

Gone are the interviews with the novelists Russell Banks and Salar Abdoh. 

Gone is the interview with Kevin Sharp, a former federal judge, on the case of Leonard Peltier. 

Gone are the interviews with economists David Harvey and Richard Wolff. 

Gone are the interviews with the combat veterans and West Point graduates Danny Sjursen and Eric Edstrom about our wars in the Middle East. 

Gone are the discussions with the journalists Glenn Greenwald and Matt Taibbi. 

Gone are the voices of those who are being persecuted and marginalized, including the human rights attorney Steven Donziger and the political prisoner Mumia Abu Jamal. None of the shows I did on mass incarceration, where I interviewed those released from our prisons, are any longer on YouTube. 

Gone are the shows with the cartoonists Joe Sacco and Dwayne Booth. Melted into thin air, leaving not a rack behind. 

I received no inquiry or notice from YouTube. I vanished. In totalitarian systems you exist, then you don’t. 

Are we a more informed and better society because of this censorship? Is this a world we want to inhabit where those who know everything about us and about whom we know nothing can instantly erase us?

➨ chrishedges.substack.com/p/on-being-disappeared

Join:👇
@G3News

_source.channeltitle: Mut zur Analyse, Mut zur Befreiung
_source.message:
Frühes Leben und Ausbildung von Selçuk Bayraktar

Bayraktar stammt ursprünglich aus Trabzon und wurde 1979 im Istanbuler Stadtteil Sarıyer als zweites Kind von Özdemir Bayraktar und Canan Bayraktar geboren. Sein Vater Özdemir (1948-2021) gründete 1984 das türkische Luft- und Raumfahrtunternehmen, das ebenfalls Baykar heißt. Selçuk besuchte zunächst die Grundschule in Sarıyer und anschließend das Robert College, das er 1997 abschloss. Im selben Jahr begann er ein Studium an der Fakultät für Elektronik und Kommunikationstechnik der Technischen Universität Istanbul. Während seines Studiums erhielt er ein Stipendium des GRASP-Labors an der University of Pennsylvania, wo er 2004 einen Master-Abschluss erwarb. Im Rahmen seiner Masterarbeit demonstrierte er erfolgreich die Luft-Boden-Koordination von UAVs im Formationsflug mit territorialen Roboterteams. Diese Arbeit erregte Aufmerksamkeit, so dass ihm ein weiteres Stipendium des Massachusetts Institute of Technology angeboten wurde.  Im Anschluss an seine Studien unter der Leitung von George Pappas und Eric Feron erwarb Bayraktar seinen zweiten Master-Abschluss mit seiner Forschung über autonome, aggressive Manöver von unbemannten Hubschraubersystemen.

Karriere

Nach seiner Ausbildung kehrte er 2007 in die Türkei zurück und wurde Chief Technology Officer von Baykar. Unter seiner Leitung entwickelte Baykar Bayraktar UAVs, das erste einheimische UAV-Projekt der Türkei, darunter das Bayraktar Mini UAV, Bayraktar TB2, Bayraktar VTOL und Bayraktar Akıncı. Diese Fahrzeuge wurden von türkischen Sicherheitskräften bei Antiterroroperationen gegen die PKK eingesetzt und waren an Konflikten wie dem syrischen Bürgerkrieg, dem zweiten libyschen Bürgerkrieg, dem zweiten Berg-Karabach-Krieg und der russischen Invasion in der Ukraine 2022 beteiligt. Im März 2021 kündigte Bayraktar ein neues UAV-Modell Bayraktar TB3 an, das eine MALE-Drohne ist und eine Ergänzung zu den nach Bayraktar TB2 benannten UAVs der TB-Serie des Unternehmens. Das neue Flugzeug soll auf dem ersten amphibischen Angriffsschiff der Türkei, der TCG Anadolu, eingesetzt werden. Im April 2021 gab Bayraktar das Ziel bekannt, den Erstflug des ersten im Inland hergestellten unbemannten Kampfjets der Türkei im Jahr 2023 durchzuführen.

Ein weiteres wichtiges Projekt, das Bayraktar leitet, ist das erste fliegende Auto der Türkei (bemanntes eVTOL), Cezeri. Cezeri führte seinen ersten Flug im September 2020 vor und schwebte autonom 10 Meter über dem Boden. Über das Fahrzeug und den Flug wurde weltweit in den Medien ausführlich berichtet. (Wiki)

Das sind sehr interessante Stationen, der der Gründer von Baykar da durchlebte. Und auch die Konflikte, in denen seine "Produkte"™ involviert sind.

Funfact:

Bayraktar spielte während der COVID-19-Pandemie zusammen mit führenden türkischen Technologieunternehmen eine entscheidende Rolle bei der Entwicklung und Herstellung des ersten medizinischen Beatmungsgeräts des Landes, das auf der Intensivstation eingesetzt wurde.
